climbs.name: Women and Children First
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Bob Pettit

content.description: Starts on short face with single bolt to small ledge. Next, continue in dihedral and crack, past some fun climbing to 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: doubles from tips through #3, nuts, a few draws and slings.
content.location: Starts below dihedral that is on left side of southern wall. Route is just left of Family Jules and under a tree high on a ledge.

climbs.name: Wilderness Therapy
climbs.fa: Aaron Collins, Laurel Arndt, Sayfe Kia, Lauren Mead, Brett Van De Sande

content.description: Awesome Crack Climbing!!!One of the best trad lines at Christopher Creek!It’s broken into two sections by a ledge at about 40 feet. The first section is the business with a steep just past vertical right leaning crack system to anchors just below a bushy ledge. Head right and follow the crack up through a widish crack with plenty of small gear to the top.
content.protection: Doubles from .3 to #3, two-bolt anchors with rings at 30 feet and at the top.
content.location: 30’ o the left of the massive  bolted vertical scoop in the wall.Starts in a short smooth corner on rounded  mondo sloppy jugs that you mantle to reach a slightly over hanging right  trending crack system.

climbs.name: Tweety Bird  Lower Var.
climbs.fa: S Hernandez K Noble A Collins

content.description: Starts on two bolt face next to a little tree and links into Tweety Bird at the upper dihedral.
content.location: Just right of Tweety Bird

climbs.name: Tweety Bird
climbs.fa: A Collins, A Endres,  SA Little,  L Arndt, K Nobel

content.description: Starts in a smooth v corner and head out right crawl through a dihedral and head out right to a hidden bolt just out of sight but will come into view as you get higher right and out of the corner. You can stop at the anchors or continue up the 5.6 face to the top of the wall.  It’s still has quite a bit of lichen on it but will clean up with more traffic.  If you go to the top you can access the upper shelf  from there. It will require 2 rappels to get down with a 60m rope.  Lots of draws (15) and maybe a few runners would be nice.
content.location: Stats just above the little boulder field in the creek on a nice shaded deck.

climbs.name: Take This Moment
climbs.fa: Pierce Libbey & Nicole Schmidt 06/13/2021

content.description: Scramble on top of the boulder at the base and clip the first bolt. Pull a muscley move on great holds and ride the pipe to a crux as it thins out. Pull the roof, take a moment to smile, and enjoy easier climbing to the chains.
content.location: Start on top of the boulder below the obvious, overhanging, orange and black streaked scoop feature.

climbs.name: Southern Comfort
climbs.fa: A Collins,  R Myers, M Rangel

content.description: Two starts. 1 climbing the face protecting  horizontal crack to ledge with right facing dihedral and bomber finger crack. Start 2 climb under and around roof to ledge.   climb crack system to ledge with a tree and two bolt anchor.
content.location: Most obvoius crack line on the wall ending at a ledge with a tree.

climbs.name: Southern Blood
climbs.fa: A Collins JJ Taylor Bruce  Ashley  Endres and the BABs

content.description: This route is a bit spicy where it's easy, and well protected where it's not. Climbs 4 bolts to the roof and links to of all my friends.
content.location: Between all my friends and Pixie Bell

climbs.name: Southern Bell
climbs.fa: A Collins S Duemler D Evans C Kolenborn

content.description: Southern Bell starts on easy climbing using jugs and ledges to access a shallow dihedral. Protect the flake before you get to the first bolt. Clip the bolt at that start of the dihedral and follow the bolt line to the top. There are anchors just after the ledge in case you are looking for a shorter route. You can pick from three routes to get to the top. 1 Straight up, following the bolts. 2 Step left 10' then climb the finger crack joining back onto the OG Line clipping 2 bolt to the anchors 3 take run out slab right to left facing dihedral and use anchors for 4 Same as but 3 step right on to the face of continue to the top passing 2 bolts.
content.location: Left of black lung

climbs.name: Shenanigans
climbs.fa: Aaron Collins Ken Noble Ross Cowan

content.description:
This route is Hands down the absolute coolest route I have put up!  The moves through the roof took many many tries to unlock but it went so much easier than expected once I figured it out! Seriously if your trad game is good then you will be smiling all the way to the chains!!Bring your phone!! Shenanigans is very photogenic! Starts off the log and protects with  good gear below the roof. A BD .4 #1 or #2 work well below the roof. 5.8

 Clip next two bolts with longer or extender draws. Crux 5.11 (not 11-)Follow the finger crack though a slightly overhung right facing dihedral with some stemming and even some chimney moves you’ll gain a ledge and get a great rest.   5.10Protect the move off the ledge with a .3   There is a  BD .2 .1 0  befit you get to the next bolt.  From the bolt stay on the arete passing several more bolts to the top for best climbing and positioning!!! 5.8
content.protection: 7 bolts and tap rings at the top  micro-med gear   Doubles .3 and.4
content.location: The only route on southern wall with a roof 15” off the deck. Just left of Women an Children First 5.8  right facing corner with bushes 30 feet up. You can’t miss the big log jammed into the wall. Starts off the log.

climbs.name: Pixie Bell
climbs.fa: SheriAnne Little Aaron Collins

content.description: Pixie bell follows crimps through the bulge and up to the chains.
content.location: Just right of Grandpas Watching

climbs.name: Monster
climbs.fa: A collins

content.description: Monster climbs the face right of and shares anchors with city of stone.
content.location: One the sunny deck next to tree and the corner route city of stone

climbs.name: Lub Dub Arete
climbs.fa: A collins

content.description: Great route! Short and we’ll protected:) Starts in the gully and moves out right to the arete to the top.
content.location: Right wall of the gulley route

climbs.name: Layin' in the Shade
climbs.fa: Ryan Myers, Aaron Collins, Manuel Rangel, Ryan Chamberlain, Leonardo Ramirez, Brian Stetson

content.description: Another awesome addition to the Southern Wall. Climb fun and varied movements including delicate arete climbing, an exposed traverse and a sweet roof to get through. Start under same roof as Southern Comfort but climb out left. From there climb straight up the arete and at the top traverse left to a good rest underneath the roof. After pulling the crux you will be on a ledge 20ft from the anchors faced with a few final moves. Really enjoyable route!
content.location: Just left of Southern Comfort. Starts with the same roof as Southern Comfort but goes out left, then heads straight up to the arete.

climbs.name: La Gata
climbs.fa: A collins k noble

content.description: Climbs the corner crack starting in the v-corner whitch is the start to Tweety Bird and ATL Wings.  Take the crack around left to the lichen covered and bolted face that takes you to the same anchors at previously mentioned routes. There is a great cam placement between the second to last and last bolt.
content.protection: Big fingers to wide hands rack 4  and bolts.  Runners would be great.
content.location: Starts in the same spot as tweety bird. Just above the Boulder field in the creek.

climbs.name: The Gully Route
climbs.fa: A collins

content.description: The gulley route was put up to allow easy access to the upper shelf and it gets harder and steeper the higher you go. There are three ways to climb this route.1. Climb it to access the upper shelf 2 bolts with rap rings. 13 drawsThis will require 2 raps to get down with a single 60 m rope2. Climb it to the second set of anchors on the left face 10 bolts. this uses a full 60 m rope  to lower off3. Climb to the first set of anchors 40’  easy 5th class
content.location: Starts off a grassy patch in the obvious gulley with a huge deck a little under half way up.

climbs.name: Grandpa's Watching
climbs.fa: A.Collins B.Pettit (ffa)

content.description: Follow the hand crack through a bulge using edges out right to gain the face. Look for .4/yellow or green Alien placement, a DMM #2 nut slots well a little higher to the left. Place a #1 Camalot in the left most horizontal pod just before entering the shallow bomb bay with a single bolt. Clip bolt from the huge jug, then move through the bulge to the anchor.
content.protection: .5, #2, #3,  yellow alien, #2 dmm nut, #1 1bolt in that order.
content.location: Look for the hand crack that spits the lower face, 20' left of the arete

climbs.name: Family Jules
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Bob Petit

content.description: Left of Bob's Chimney. Ascent shallow crack to tree, then wide crack with one bolt then gear in back - crack narrows as you get higher to top. Two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Single 0.3, #2, #4 , Doubles 0.5, 0.75, #1; nuts. That rack will give you some options. One quick draw and a couple trad draws. First piece of gear is in dark crack slightly to right of route.

climbs.name: Endres Game
climbs.fa: A Collins Ashley Endres

content.description: Climbs a squeezy slick dihedral through two roofs.  Absolutely fantastic route! Fun route for all size climbers!!
content.location: This route starts in a left-leaning corner off a small 3’ ledge just above a small little swim hole, directly across the creek from the giant split boulder.

climbs.name: El Alquimista
climbs.fa: A Collins S Duemler  K Noble

content.description: One of the best lines in the canyon!!Starts in a smooth steep crack down low then turns a lip to a slap climb vertical slightly overhanging flakes. Pull through the cool dihedral  and finish up to the top.
content.protection: 13 Bolts 3-4 shoulder length slings will help with rope drag.
content.location: Starts in obvious smooth right leaning crack  at waters edge.  Left of tweety bird.

climbs.name: Dax’s Dilemma
climbs.fa: Aaron Collins, Ken Noble, Sam Hernandez, Ashley Endres

content.description: This is a stellar steep corner half way up the gully on the right side. It has good options for gear.
content.protection: Bolts and standard rack small to #3?
content.location: Starts  in the same gulley  but  half way up the gulley on the right

climbs.name: Concierge
climbs.fa: A Collins R Myers P Sakievich D Evans C Kolenborn

content.description: Bolted face left of grassy corner leading up to steeper rock towards the top.There is a farely run out section in the middle with easy climbing on jugs that lead to a shelf.Clip the bolt that protects the mantel. Climb the face to the arete  on the left and a hand crack towards the top.
content.protection: 8 Bolts, one or two alpine draws might be good.
content.location: Left of grassy dihedral and right of Black Lung

climbs.name: City of Stone
climbs.fa: A Collins

content.description: Aka Petra climbs a right facing dihedral past 4 bolts to rap rings.
content.location: It's the short corner route on a nice sun deck  just before you drop off a 7' cliff to continue up stream. There is a single bolt on the face to the right to be used as a directional for the short easy TR, Monsters.

climbs.name: Chieftain
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Bob Petit, Aaron Collins

content.description: Starts easy and gives you a chance to warm up to the crux around the fourth and fifth bolts - steep crimps, side pulls and finger locks. The whole climb is steep after the 2nd bolt. Enjoy a rest after the crux on a ledge then continue up airy climbing and try not to pump out to the top. Rating is a close estimate at this time, route has only been TR'd.
content.location: At the confluence of Spring Creek and Christopher Creek, just above the falls is a prominent tooth of rock, plainly visible as you look at the southern wall from across the gorge from the other side.

climbs.name: The Chase
climbs.fa: A Collins, L Arndt, K Noble

content.description: Starts on ATL wings then heads out left after you pull over the slab and finishes on La Gata.
content.protection: Bolts and  1 hand size piece can help with a bit of a run out on 5.7 terrain.  Runners can be helpful
content.location: Starts in the v corner above the Boulder field in the creek.

climbs.name: Bob's Chimney
climbs.fa: B.Pettit A.Collins

content.description: Climbs chimney and left facing digital then head left to share anchors with Grandpa's Watching. This is not an easy lead with marginal gear at best. BOB's a bad ass for putting this up ground up. He may go back a place bolts to make it a safer route.more to come possibly.
content.location: Obvious shallow chimney

climbs.name: Black Lung
climbs.fa: A Collins R Myers M Rangel

content.description: Climb the black water streak  head left at the crack follow bolts to chain just beneath the tree.
content.location: Starts just under a small roof and on to the black streak follow bolted line to anchors under the tree.

climbs.name: Beans and Baby Dicks
climbs.fa: Manuel Rangel, Ryan Myers, Ryan Chamberlain, Leonardo Ramirez, Aaron Collins

content.description: This is a challenging trad line that angles left throughout the entire route. Start at the bottom of Black Lung and climb the crack to the anchors of Southern Comfort.
content.protection: Small to medium gear, possible doubles .5-.75 if you want to sew it up
content.location: Located between Southern Comfort and Black Lung

climbs.name: ATL Wings
climbs.fa: Aaron C,   Ken Noble, Laurel Arndt, SA Little, Lou Lou Durant

content.description: Climb the horizontal cracks with really cool movement then stay in the face to the pointed roof. Shares anchors with TB.
content.location: Horizontal cracks left of the v corner above the Boulder field in the creek.

content.description: The Southern Wall  faces north and is located just along the creek. It provides shade all day. It has a great ledge to walk along the creek and to access the number of future routes. There will easily be 20 routes, both trad and sport in this area. CAN'T WAIT! It's a perfect summer crag! Climb in the shade then jump in the sunny creek. Watch for canyoneers finishing the canyon. Close your eyes as they strip out of their wetsuits.
